title: Season 6 Metagolem and You
body:
It's happened again. This six item build can go on any melee champion and still work: {{item:3111}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3053}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3742}}. It doesn't matter if you're {{champion:122}} or {{champion:84}}, {{champion:48}} or {{champion:23}}, I've even seen it work on {{champion:31}} and {{champion:154}}.
For those who are unfamiliar, a Metagolem is a six item build that can be put on any champion and still work. In Season 4 there was a less often implemented metagolem using Trinity Force, Frozen Mallet, Atma's Impaler, Warmog's Armor, Randuin's Omen, and Mercury's Treads that saw use on champions from Jarvan IV to Corki before Atma's was removed from the game. Prior to season 4 there were other metagolems like 5 Cleavers/Sunfire Capes/Warmog's/Bloodthirsters and boots or a weird combination of gold generation and health regen using a laundry list of items that no longer exist. [This dev corner post by Riot Axes](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/fWOVQoin-followup-juggernaut-items) implies that metagolems are undesirable for game health.
I saw a [board post](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/naqnZw1E-riot-so-tank-fiora-yi-and-akali-are-a-thing-a-quick-question-about-item-design) the other day and many of the comments used the term metagolem, which I had never heard before. I did some research since I was very green during season 4 and never played Twitch with 5 Sunfire Capes or Pantheon with 5 Black Cleavers.
I've refrained from actually stating my opinion because I want to hear what the community thinks: Are Metagolems a problem? If they are, why are they a problem and how do we fix it? I'm willing to bet at least half of us haven't ever talked about or even heard about them.
Please comment with your ideas and opinions.
http://s14.postimg.org/c00t4zfjl/New_Metagolem.png

replies.body:
For everyone asking for S2 back:

You happy now?
Hm?

> [{quoted}](name=CaptainMårvelous,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEWjn3NO,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2016-02-29T21:28:20.959+0000)
>
> For everyone asking for S2 back:
> 
> You happy now?
> Hm?

Except in season 2 fights were significantly longer. Right now, there is too much damage in the game for this season to look like it did back then. But in some way, it's the same except fights are shorter. Carries deal more damage, but they get destroyed faster if they get caught. Some champions have absolutely insane true damage ({{champion:114}} {{champion:11}} ) and the fact there is so much of uncounterable damage (%health, strong arpen and mpen steroids) mean you can't make the fights last longer aka be more healthy, for everyone. There's always gonna be one guy that can't follow that rule because he has that much %health damage. And champions that are now designed on : you kill this guy instantly or you get kited to death ({{champion:429}} {{champion:67}} ) or instantly melted ({{champion:11}}), don't stay for 5 stacks or it's over ({{champion:122}} , much more than pre-rework)

Only exception there is that I remember mages being extremely good at oneshooting squishies in S2. And most versions of dfg were pretty retarded (lolol 60% current health on active).
I feel resistances and health were more valuable (there wasn't as much true damage, %health damage) and the offensive itemization especially on ad carries was better with sustain. Bloodthirster was a first item. Fights weren't as much oneshooting each other, slightly more sustain-oriented.

I feel overall like in season 2, there was way more of a strategic aspect, in buiding items, using spells such as attack speed reducing [that has been severely nerfed, removed on certain champions] to get a healthy way to deny an ad carry without hurr-durr-i-oneshot-you. I remember Shurelia as well, which was a great item that also allowed some champions that otherwise would have been somewhat bad in teamfights to actually bring something great for their teammates ({{champion:75}}  for instance).

I also remember the locket that gave armor and the bulwark, but that's from season 3 if i recall correctly. Cost-efficient items, not broken in lane, that actually are a nice asset in teamfights are supergood design.

Whereas right now, it's league of call of duty and all about protect/kill the carries. Teamfight comps are not based on combo synergizing with different champions, nah.. it's GET CC AND PROTECT THE CARRY. ONE SHOOT THE OTHER CARRY. CC THE ASSASSIN. Not like the good old Amumu-Wukong-Orianna-MF.

I just feel like there's been a crazy powercreep over the years with mobility, damage and crowd control. If someone told me 3 years ago about, idk, Kalista's passive, Yasuo's E, Nautilus' amount of CC (why on earth was E cooldown so much reduced), Fiora's passive... I would have laughed at his face. And I think we are seeing this powercreep indirectly with towers, who aren't weaker than they were. People just deal more damage, killing faster, and escape more easily.

Yet, maybe my memories are a bit flawed about the overall damage being smaller, due to nostalgy, and the fact I was way worse in skill level as I am now, so my opponents as well must have sucked compared to what I'm facing now.

Yes. Though the morde is better here than in season 2. {{champion:82}} 

For that matter champion balance is better than it was back then. I still loved season 2
Oof, don't let G&B hear you saying that.
Sigh.. Season two Mordekaiser with 13 hp pot start.
He was the reason they are now limited to 5.
not all of S2 was metagolem, thats like saying entire S3 was leagus of cleavers, or S5 was cinderhulk
{{champion:25}} "As a Morgana main from S2, yes, I am very happy."

I don't understand this and have pretty much never understood this concept.

{{item:3031}} {{item:3046}} {{item:3072}} {{item:3036}} {{item:3006}} {{item:3102}} 

Six items, that can be built on *any* ranged champion with an AA to make them do tons of damage.  This list has worked since Season 0.

This game has *NEVER* had strong item diversity and likely *NEVER* will.

----------------------

The difference now?

Some parts of that can be interchanged.  
{{item:3143}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3156}}   all see consistent use and play.

{{item:3087}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3812}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3142}} {{item:3139}}  are the same.

Itemization has *IMPROVED* but still isn't *DEEP* since it's just minor differences for same general item.

What would make itemization "deep", though? I mean, damage dealers are going to build damage items, mages are going to build mage items, tanks are going to build tank items, because items in each category synergize with themselves. That's just how stats scale. Making items universally attractive would mean either they're horribly overpowered or you've overhauled how champions and items scale entirely.
Look @ DotA 2 for deep itemization.
DotA 2 items work in a completely different way. You can't have a minimally similar model in LoL without reworking the entire game.

Oh I know, i was more so leaning towards more actives, more cc effects (more silences, look more into disarms, more polymorphs, etc.). 

Also, DotA's system isn't TOO different from League.  Intelligence gives mana and mana regen, Strength gives HP and HP Regen, Agility gives Attack Speed and Armor.  Other than that, theres the flat AD stat (like on League), HP, Mana, Mana regen, etc. as standalone stats.  There's also evasion (was dodge, removed) and crit.  Probs a couple more I forgot.

I just think there needs to be more active/semi-active abilities in League, thats it.  Stuff like Orchid Malevolence (silence and damage amp), Lotus Orb (like Banshees, but instead of blocking the spell, it reflects it back at them), Helm of the Dominator (take control of neutral/enemy minions), Force Staff (shoves target in the direction they're facing), etc. would all work in League with number tuning.

Side note: I split items into 4 types: stat only, active, semi-active (passives that require some sort of activation, zekes is an example of this), and passive (liandry's torment)

Right now the only item you build for active more than anything else (imho) is Zhonya's. I think it'd be a bit problematic stat wise but I don't know. I'd like to see more powerful active/passives instead of stats in items.

The way "Metagolem" was defined in the OP wasn't exactly acurate.

"Metagolem" originally referred to a six-item set of _bruiser_ items specifically back in S2, and the original used an item eerily reminiscent of Titanic Hydra, good ol' Atma's Impaler.

i played alot in S2, and i can not remomber a six-item golem, it mostly reffered to atmogs, most of the time with sunfire and mercs, so thats 4 items. The rest still vas variable.
And i often did yous other builts than the golem with great succes...
Also, Atmas recived a nerf somewhere mid S2 and the metagolem ended. This second half of S2 was imo the best period lol had ever seen.

Yeah, I remember hearing about the five item metagolem, but I don't think a sixth item was required.

http://i.imgur.com/qVU9M.png
I always wanted to put a glove on my foot.

Foot gloves?
We have those
Theyre called **Socks**
In order to really be foot-gloves, they've gotta be the kind with toes ;P
Awkardly enough they do exist though.
Those are Foot Mittens you illiterate cretin.

Fun fact:
The German word for glove, 'handschuh' (~hand-shooh), literally translates to 'hand shoe'. 'Hand' translates to, well, 'hand' and 'schuh' translates to 'shoe'.

Metagolems are unhealthy. However it generally shows problems with synergy between items more than champions themselves. In today's case, it's the synergy between DMP and Titanic Hydra providing so much onhit damage while making your champion unkitable.

Add in the powerful shield and good resistances from all the other items and Sterak's Gage, and you've got unkillable melee monsters that honestly are just so anti-fun to play against.

> unkillable melee monsters that honestly are just so anti-fun to play against.

Juggernauts, you just described Juggernauts.  Also half the items are specifically designed for Juggernauts, because they are cancerous at their core.
bruisers, he just described bruisers. not a subset of immobile bruisers who are actually easy to kite and currently aren't an issue right now, where the general mobile bruiser abusing their items is.

{{champion:68}} {{item:3068}} {{item:3111}} {{item:3742}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3748}} {{item:3053}} yes

The ascension has begun

yea but in this case however i do not think its just the items.

It gives medium tanky resistances 200 armor 150 mr and a fuckton of health 
Makes you less kitable sure
Gives some sustained damage yep

But when adc and assassin run rampant and are penetrating half your bonus armor or about 50 flat armor then getting more then 200 armor is a complte waste of stacks with less magic damage dealers around the 150 mr + tons of hp makes you unkillabel for ppl who build ap, as they usually rely on nuking your ass and dps mages are doing really bad right now.

All we see today are mobile bursty adc and ad assassin so you want roughly 200 armor as it is the optimal amount and you want as much hp as possible to prevent being bursted down
Then there is the issue of too much mobility so you get deadmans to be less easy to kite and you need some damage to kill them once you get into their face.

This build, and or variations on it, is the only one which allows one to stand up to the currently rampant running hyper mobile ad burst champions.

Once AD burst champions have their mobility and burst toned down a tad it leaves room for other more lategame scaling dps carries who can deal with a build like this. 

tldr;
Certain champion groups are overtuned, they are crowding out any other picks and this is the only melee build which can deal with them.
Wait has Sunfire Cape always had that logo on it? How have I never noticed a Shuriman Logo?
cause unless you have a giant monitor, the image is to small to recognise it?
I have a 17'' monitor and I can see it clearly.
~~It got an icon update in either late S4 or early S5. I forget which.~~ No, wait. That was the fire sfx that got updated. So, yeah, it's looked like that for a while.
time for reckonning {{champion:67}}
Should have put the gage on the right and shoe on the left, would have looked like deadman's shoulder into gage for a hand.

IF a realy metagolem arises, meaining that alot of different champs all go for the exact same built regardless of the situation and also have more succes than other builts at that, then we have a problem.(with the side effect that champs who can effectivly use that built are stronger than champs that can't)

Also, i haven't seen any working 6item metagolem(outside of adc) and i play since the end of beta.
It's usually 3-4 items and the rest is variable

The current metagolem is Titanic, SV, deadmans and steraks. 
And only titanic is a bit overtuned due to the AA-reset on the active. If properly used the active alone can add 600-700 extra burst with 400-5000 of that beeing aoe.
SV always was the most popular mr item as it lacks competition. It's usually taken over banshies because of the cdr, and the other options are just far behind in terms of effective combat stats compared to SV and Banshies, though i personally often use maw instead with great succes.
Deadman's still offers the ms, and thus it will stay dominant unless the stats are so utterly shit that no one ever wants it.
Sterak still is the single ost effective item for raw tankiness with the 30% health shield while offering some damage on top, and as long as the game resolves so much around damage and especially burst, melees simply need alot protection vs burst and damage in general, else they die befor doing anything.

The big thing with the current metagolem is that while beeing arguably effective on most users, the champs useing it are far from dominateing the meta. The current metagolem is simply a symptom of the overabundance of ranged damage, as stacking that much survivabillity is the only way to funktion without **massive** snowballing on most of the users, and titanic just is kinda op but desperatly needed so those champs posses any threat at all with the built.
So imo the current golem isn't a broken built, but a shout out for help, kinda the last option for many melees to be any relevant.

There is a reason why cc-tanks and adc, assasins and a few mages are all that is played in proplay right now. If you can't burst down a target very quickly or offer good cc, your only chance as a melee is early snowballing and/or splitpushing as you won't live long enough for your kit to work in teamfights.

Spirit Visage can be changed with Maw depending on the champion for better results. Besides that, this is a metagolem. Yes.

I also see a recurring theme of metagolem builds having a few items that have both Decent/Big Tank + Decent/Big Damage with the item.
I can see a nerf to Titanic and/or Sterak's in the future. Deadman's damage aspect as well perhaps.

> [{quoted}](name=Inept Maverick,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UEWjn3NO,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-29T18:55:21.190+0000)
> Spirit Visage can be changed with Maw depending on the champion for better results. Besides that, this is a metagolem. Yes.
 
DON'T YOU TOUCH MY SPIRIT VISAGE!

-Every Maokai main ever.
I miss Atma's now.
theres too many strong options to really have a "metagolem" in the old atmogs sense. i mean this image doesnt include zzrot even though its super meta.
MY MLG JUGGERNAUT CHO'GATH BUILD IS RECOGNIZED! REJOICE!

Metagolems are a problem for item/strategic diversity. If those items are so strong on any champ, it basically implies that the synergy they provide is more valuable than the champion you pick, and I think that's bad for the game. Basically, just by existing, those items push a specific meta (hence the term) regardless of the champions picked.

I discovered meta golems in the same post as you, I have since tried the s6 meta golem on several champs and the results have changed my life forever
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}}
What about Talon?
oh my GOD. Why is this still working with cinderhulk?

akali is hands down the strongest champion toplane that now exclusivly uses these itmes. the fact that she can be so tanky and still do shit tims of damage and dont forget about her mobility. i thought tanks were slow, like in reality if a person was to wear a full suit of armor then they couldnt move as fast as somebody with less.this game is in a very unhelthy state at which champions can just go full tank and still outdamage most champions that do not.. AKALI ALISTAR NASUS are the biggest problems i see. but how do you even nerf that? remove itmes from the game? i doubt that riot will do that. and how much more can aklali get nerfed before she is a jungle camp? ABSOLUTELY UNHEALTHY IN EVERY WAY. from when i started playing (season2) until now, i have seen more and more issues with more and more champions each patch. this is getting outlandish. i wish riot would do nerfs and balances for REAL LEAGUE OF LEGENDS, not just for the pros. that is why so many things have gone on for so long imbalanced. poor practice to forget the majority of your community(99%) who plays real league and then only focus on pros. eventually people are gonna see taht there is a problem and stop playing the game. but so much time and money investments stops most people from playing(me included)
Metagolem < {{champion:67}}
how would you even build this, path-wise?
Those pretty much fits to {{champion:106}} .

ive seen darius do this and i gotta admit it was pretty powerfull on him but i haven't seen other champs do it as much and i have been playing quite a bit these days. 

most of these items (except spirit) have been nerfed in the last half year

the main reason you will see this build is for the following reasons.

{{item:3742}} you stuffed too much mobility in this game period every tank worth his salt will need this.
{{item:3111}} now that riot has given it a worthwhile amount of tenacity ofc imobile champs will NEED this there is no other option available it all got nerfed.
{{item:3053}} even with going full tank assasins and adc have INSANE burst atm how else do you expect them to deal with that.
{{item:3068}} this could be replaced by {{item:3143}}  or {{item:3025}}  or{{item:3110}}  or{{item:3022}}  so i dont see an issue here.
{{item:3748}} how many tanks have wave clear issues? thats right a lot this is a problem with their kit not the item. if i were to go off meta and go braum top i would rush this item so i can waveclear and then build everything else that you just listed
{{item:3065}} there are only 2 mr items currently for tanks to deal with massive amounts of magic damage. with the rise of champions like {{champion:99}}  and a whole other bunch of champions can you be surprised that people will go for an item that gives them a whopping 70 mr? i don't mr itemization is ok for the first time since they removed Force of nature.

if this item path is such an issue perhaps it would do riot good to look at the REAL problem instead.


and lets not forget that metagolem you are talking about is a 6 item build path when have you seen games go on for that long or tanks get enough gold to get that many items for that matter? currently games last 25-30 minutes and more often then not end roughly around 20 minutes without a team even trying to surrender cuz they were already at the inhib.
Maybe I'll have to give the metagolem a go. I'll feel disgusting about it but might as well try.
